author: wn.com
title: DEM 2016-Clinton-Trump story
text: LAS VEGAS (AP) â€” Hillary Rodham Clinton went to Donald Trump's doorstep Monday to mock the Republican presidential front-runner on the eve of the first Democratic presidential debate. The appearance at a boisterous rally of the politically potent Culinary Workers Union was a win-win for Clinton, letting her signal her support for an influential union while taking aim at the Democratic party's favorite foil. The union, which represents casino and resort workers, is trying to organize hotel employees and invited all of the five candidates in town for the debate to the rally. Eric Trump, an executive vice president at the Trump organization and the presidential candidate's son, said workers at the hotel are largely happy. ...
